title: A Step Above
text: This restaurant turns sushi into delicious artwork. I love the sablefish, the ebi dumplings, the lobster roll, the gyoza, chirashi sushi .. and sometimes simply the sashimi.. its so fresh. This is one of my favorite places to go after a long work week. I always feel taken care of and delighted in every way.

title: Always a memorable evening at Mangia E Bevi
text: This is one of my favorites on the North Shore. The staff are always friendly and inviting. I just feel special from the moment we come in the door. The menu is full of delicious options. They have a great wine list too! If you want a guaranteed special date night, this little hideaway guarantees it in every way.

title: I ran by this pub.. I love the name!
text: I haven't eaten there but I ran by and noticed the place was full at 11:00 am.. looks like a nice place to go.

title: After a day at Caldera Beach, watch the sunset from here.
text: We've dropped in here twice now after a day spent swimming at Caldera Beach. The couple who own it is delightful. The wine, the view, and the appies are great!

title: Great place to spend a day
text:
The water is warm and clean... great swimming here. Bring your beach shoes though, the rocks are a little tough on your feet getting in and out of the water.
There is a sweet restaurant right on Caldera Beach to finish up the day at.. sip a glass of wine, watch the sunset & enjoy a great Greek Salad, and eggplant appie before you head home.

title: We feel so taken care of here... lovely Villas & staff are so helpful
text:
This is a fabulous place to stay. The owner of the hotel can't do enough for you. The rooms are beautiful with a full vista of the sea.
We are also so grateful to have a massage on the recommendation of the owner -- thiraform.gr My husband and I had one-hour massages by expert masseuse Eva & her partner. I would highly recommend having a massage with them. I wish we had known about them sooner... we would have booked them a few times. Call. 0030 6986 38930, or just ask the owner of the Hotel to book them for you.

title: Beautiful view and the food was gourmet.
text: We had a wonderful meal here and the view is stunning. Great for a romantic night. It was a little more expensive than other meals we've had out.. but totally worth it.

title: Storybook experience
text: It's really quaint... with some beautiful silk shops and art galleries. It's all so ancient with original stones.. so glad to have seen it.

title: Magical
text: Never seen such a magnificent view. People were saving spots on the top of Oia to secure their photos. I've also never seen so many wedding photos at one time!

title: Wow the views are stunning from here.
text:
This was an incredible place to stay. It overlooks an expansive sea with a 360 view in all directions. It's quite the adventure getting to the hotel .. there is a bit of a hike to the actual hotel as it is nestled into the side of the mountain. The hotel bellman are like Greek Gods carrying all the heavy suitcases.
I'd recommend staying for at least a few days as it takes a long time to get to this side of the Island.
The Hotel provides a shuttle bus which is great.. we might have got lost otherwise. :-)

title: It is a very basic presentation of how olives are pressed into oil
text: We rented a car and drove around the island today expecting the Olive Press Museum to be a highlight.. but it was a little anti-climatic. It's ok. But we could have skipped it and spent more time visiting remote beaches today on Naxos.

title: Family style restaurant passed down from generations.
text: We met the owner, Paulo. His Father owned the original Meltemi which was located in old town and they used to serve 3k people per day back in the day (bigger size restaurant)... today they serve 3 hundred people per day effortlessly. There is music, history, and great food. Definitely worth checking out.

title: The location is fun
text: It's located in front of a turn around so its great for people watching and to get a feeling of Naxos. The food was ok... I had the stuffed tomatoes and my husband ordered the lamb. Both were pretty good but not amazing.

title: Not a fan of these back to back restaurants .. very commercial.
text: We had a crumby lunch here when we first arrived. With the plastic sheeting that divides all the restaurants and just the touristy vibe, it's not one of my fav experiences. Some may like it. For us it was so-so.

title: Apollo's Gate is really fantastic at night!
text: This is a great place to take photos as the sunsets. You will find the backdrop views are breathtaking. And when the sunsets, Apollo's Gate is fully lit up... it's really a dramatic experience.

title: Elegant Evening under the Stars
text: This restaurant is just a little bit nicer than any other we've experienced here. It's romantic.. they have music playing and its right on the beach. The food is just gourmet. I've never had a better meal in Greece. It was so good, we are likely to go back in a few days.

title: Wonderful place for a morning run!
text: I had a wonderful run along this beach this morning. There are a number of windsurfer spots here. The beach is open and practically your own. Loved it.

title: Wonderful place to stay in Naxos!
text:
Antony Suites is perfectly located close to the beach and some great restaurants. The room we have is so spacious and modern. I love the bathrooms -- big showers with a rain shower faucet. I really appreciate having a Nespresso coffee machine, fridge, and an iron in our room. The king size bed is really comfortable. They have really thought of everything.

The owner is really engaging. He took the time to show us all the highlights of Naxos. We have been totally delighted with our choice to stay here. I'd definitely recommend Antony Suites. It's 10/10.

title: Delighted here!
text:
From the moment we arrived, we felt so special. There were flowers and a chilled bottle of PAROS Moraitis wine waiting for us in our room. The hotel is nestled in the beautiful view of Naoussa. The staff is so caring and thoughtful.

Breakfast was the best ever... including a great cappuccino!

So happy to have found this little gem of a Hotel.

title: Best meal we've had so far in Greece!
text: This is a wonderful restaurant romantic and nestled in the back streets of Naoussa. The waiters make you feel so at home. The food was absolutely gourmet. We had the salmon bruschetta, greek salad, and seafood tagliatelle. All totally delicious.

title: Roof top dining
text: This rooftop restaurant and bar overlooks Athens and all the highlights. Acropolis and the Acropolis museum. It’s a stunning vista and the food was delicious. We just sat in the bar, sipped wine and enjoyed the fish tacos, and ceviche. Nice way to end our day.

title: They make a perfect cappuccino
text: We were so jet lagged our first day... I'm so grateful for their delicious and very helpful cappuccino(s). We loved the spanokopita too.

title: Great place to have lunch!
text: Follow the Plaka to the end and there are several very quaint restaurants that are out of the way. We had our best meal there. It is a little less busy too. We ate at Eros. Delicious lamb stew.

title: Stunning
text: The scale is breathtaking. It's interesting that the marble was originally very colorful.. and interesting to notice the restoration processes in the different layers. I found all the stories that go with the Acropolis just fascinating. We loved our visit there.

title: Spectacular
text: It's so interesting how the columns curve in and definitely join a tour guide because they have so many fascinating details to share. It's really worth it.

title: Fantastic Experience
text: This is a must. The building itself is just gorgeous with floor to ceiling windows and a magnificent entrance. It set up our experience of the Acropolis which we did day 2. Many of the original friezes are here... and it describes the architecture and design features you will see on site.

title: It's a small museum.. I'd suggest spending more time on the live site.
text: There were some good things to see here. But its a small museum. I'd recommend spending more time on the live site.

title: Take your time and enjoy this iconic place.
text: The site is so interesting. We didn't have a very good guide on this.. but we brought a guidebook and it really helped enrich our experience. Just make sure you choose a great guide and she's not rushing the tour through as fast as possible as our's was today. There is so much to see there. The Stadium is pretty much intact which is amazing. It was fascinating to see where people would come to make life decisions with the Oracle. You'll see where athletes in the time would train... just a fascinating place to see.

title: Raced through Delphi
text:
We took the day trip to Delphi. The site itself is magical ... definitely a great day excursion ..but this particular tour guide was in a bit of a rush the whole time.

We had to race to the top of the site or skip the stadium all together.. I didn’t want to miss any of it so I jogged to the top...but many on the trip never got to see the whole site. ...we had 30 mins to take in this spiritual historical site...to make it for a rushed 1/2 hour through the museum... then a quick lunch to rush and then wait for the tour bus to connect with another bus unloading to our bus.

We waited on a hot bus at that point for 45 minutes..time I wish we might have had on site. It just felt chaotic today.

If you are considering this trip, you may want to take one that allows more time...

title: The food was delicious
text: We had seafood stuffed pepper, fresh red snapper, and chicken enchiladas...all amazingly delicious. And the restaurant rooftop with live music below. Delightful server Eli.

title: Great Dinner
text: Dinner in the la trajinera...thank you Cristobal our server...amazing. Food was fabulous and such a fun night! We loved the flamed presentation. The pianist creates such a wonderful vibe..with the Cabo sunset, it was a perfect night! Thank you!

title: Loved the beach
text: It’s a little less busy at the boardwalk end..and fun vibe with music closer to the hotels. White sand, nice swimming. Definitely glad we had a day there.

title: Harbour Air is awesome. Loved the flight..
text: Its just a great way to get to Victoria and then walk to your Hotel. Beautiful seeing the gulf islands on the way... way better than sitting in ferry lineups for sure if you can do without a car.

title: A fabulous family reunion at Sundance Ranch!
text:
We had such a wonderful time this week-end at the Sundance Ranch. The staff just can't do enough for you. They are so generous of heart and spirit. The horses are so well cared for. The Ranch runs like a family and yet so professionally. The food is great too.
And get ready to do some dancing Saturday night.
My sister and I went to the Sundance Ranch when we were children. It was called the BarQ in those days and it was such a thrill to bring our own children there this week-end.
We will be making this an annual destination going forward. Thank YOU!!

title: What a fabulous experience.
text:
This resort is something to experience. We felt welcomed from the moment we arrived. The staff totally go out of their way to be helpful. Neda at the front desk is just incredible.. so warm and knowledgeable about great places to check out; favourite restaurants etc. Everyone seems so happy and proud to work here. It's a historic hotel that has really got a great energy.

The gym is understated but with state of the art equipment and basically everything you need. I'm loving the morning yoga and pilates classes (all comp)... and the resort is located right on the Seawall walk which is great for morning runs.

The beach is one of the best ever and if you get up early, you can often swim with dolphin just off the shore. Two thumbs way up.

title: Love the Acai Bowl
text: This is a great place to stop for coffee & a quick breakfast on the run. They have a great fruit acai bowl that is fabulous. The eggs are great too.

title: Great place to watch the sunset.
text: We had a salad, the Surf & Turf and a fruit crumble.. all were really good. The best thing was the view and our waiter Chris who reminds me of Warren Beatty.

title: Great food
text: We always sit at the bar when we go here. My favourite thing is their margarita's and their tuna appie. Everything is great here.

title: Great place to stay if you are wanting an affordable quick getaway
text:
The Sheraton has a great gym facing the water..great places to run here too. There are tennis courts and it is close to some great hiking places.

The rooms are basic but clean and there is a fridge in your room if you want to make your own breakfasts.

The staff are sweet and there is a family vibe here. If the Hotel did an update it could be really fantastic..but probably shift the current affordability.

Overall considering we have a car, and an drive to the beach, it's a great choice. By the way, parking is free too.

I think we might stay on the other side of the island next time. But we've had a great experience
place: Sheraton Kona Resort & Spa at Keauhou Bay

title: The view is the best part
text:
Our dinner was a little strange- 3 types of fish with mushroom soup type sauce made me feel a little sick. Wouldn't recommend it unless you stick to edamame and a drink.

It would be best to go here for apples and watch the sunset..then head somewhere else for dinner. The edamame and our salads were great..

title: A long drive to get there
text:
We went to see the volcanoes and maybe it was because of the rainy day, but it was not really worth the very long drive.

In hindsight I would have rather just watched a video of it.

title: We had an incredible experience today with Kit and Mirabai on the Office boat.
text: Kit has so much experience with dolphin, their habits and where their hangouts are... and Mirabai added such a sweet spiritual quality to the day. It was so memorable for us. Swimming with these magical mammals is now a highlight of my life. Thank you Jo-Anne from Vancouver

title: A happy get a way at Whistler
text: A warm and friendly hotel experience. The hotel is clean. The staff were so attentive and caring. The rooms themselves are a little tired. In my opinion, they could do with a big update. The bathrooms are small and old. But they have great cream and shampoo. And I was a little surprised to find we didn't have a fridge in our room, but the front desk took care of that right away. Overall we had a great experience. It was a mother/daughter weekend..Really Loved the Taminsara Spa downstairs. We had the best facial ever!! Thank you Hilton Whistler staff. Jo-Anne
